thread.title: Ahead of the Bell: Pandora shares plummet
thread.title_full: Ahead of the Bell: Pandora shares plummet - Yahoo Finance

author: yahoo
title: Ahead of the Bell: Pandora shares plummet
text:
NEW YORK (AP) -- Pandora plunged 27 percent before the opening bell after it announced a $90 million legal settlement with music studios and gave a weak financial outlook.
It said late Thursday that it expects fourth-quarter revenue in the range of $325 million to $330 million, which was short of the $338 million that Wall Street was looking for, according to a survey by FactSet.
The music streaming service settled a lawsuit over recordings made before 1972 with divisions of Sony, Warner and Universal. The studios argued that songs such as Aretha Franklin's "Respect" and the Beatles' "Hey Jude" are not covered by federal copyright law, but they have been protected in common law by states including New York. The settlement follows a similar deal in June with satellite radio giant Sirius XM, which agreed to pay $210 million.
Pandora's decision to mend ties with the music industry could open up the possibility of direct deals for international expansion or new products, said Stifel analyst John Egbert, in a note to investors.
Pandora Media Inc. has had to contend with rival Apple Music, which launched this summer. Despite the competition, the company said listener hours grew 3 percent to 5.14 billion from last year's third quarter.
The Oakland, California, company posted a third-quarter loss of $85.9 million. While revenue rose 30 percent to $311.6 million, it still came up short of Wall Street forecasts.
The stock fell, $5.17 to $14.02 in premarket trading.
